AxisConfig: Axis rendering configuration

Source: R/classes-theme.R
AxisConfig.Rd

Controls how the x-axis range and ticks are calculated.

AxisConfig(
  range_min = NA_real_,
  range_max = NA_real_,
  tick_count = NA_real_,
  tick_values = NULL,
  gridlines = FALSE,
  gridline_style = "dotted",
  ci_clip_factor = 2,
  include_null = TRUE,
  symmetric = NULL,
  null_tick = TRUE,
  marker_margin = TRUE
)

Arguments

range_min

Minimum value for axis (NA = auto from data)

range_max

Maximum value for axis (NA = auto from data)

tick_count

Target number of ticks (NA = auto)

tick_values

Explicit tick positions (overrides tick_count)

gridlines

Show gridlines on the plot

gridline_style

Style of gridlines: "solid", "dashed", or "dotted"

ci_clip_factor

CIs extending beyond this multiple of the estimate range are clipped with arrows (default: 2.0). For example, 2.0 means CIs that extend more than 2x the estimate range will be truncated. Use Inf to never clip.

include_null

Always include the null value in the axis range (default: TRUE)

symmetric

Make axis symmetric around null value. Must be explicitly set to TRUE to enable; default (NULL/FALSE) does not apply symmetry.

null_tick

Always show a tick at the null value (default: TRUE)

marker_margin

Add half-marker-width padding at edges so markers don't clip (default: TRUE)

Auto-Scaling Algorithm

When range_min/range_max are NA (auto), the axis range is calculated as:

  1. Collect all point estimates (not CI bounds)

  2. Extend range to include null value (if include_null = TRUE)

  3. Extend range to include CIs within ci_clip_factor of the estimate range

  4. Optionally make symmetric around null (if symmetric = TRUE)

  5. Apply nice rounding for clean tick values

CIs extending beyond ci_clip_factor × estimate_range are clipped with arrow indicators rather than expanding the axis.
